JobTitle: Digital Technology Analyst, Secure Call Operator - Tucson, AZ
JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD), you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.RMD Digital Technology (DT) is a full-service IT organization that enables growth of the RMD business by working with our customers to develop innovative technology solutions. RMD DT functional areas include IT Solutions, Program Support Delivery, Services, Innovation, Standards and Architecture, and Operational Excellence.Job Summary: The DT Secure Call Operator is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations for a teleconference solution capable of hosting secure, classified multi-participant conversations for the Raytheon Technologies company. The Secure Call Operator must proactively partner with Global Security Services team members across RMD to deliver a cutting-edge service by coordinating and managing the full life cycle tasks of the secure conference call service, from fulfilling teleconference requests, initiating the calls and disconnecting participants when the call concludes. The Secure Call operator will also be expected to troubleshoot minor issues that may impact the services, while communicating unplanned outages to stakeholders and leadership, as well as supporting required maintenance support tasks within designated windows. The candidate must also maintain and adhere to required security controls and policies to mitigate unplanned disruption to service.The hours of operations for the secure call service is a 12-hour window from 8AM – 8PM ET. The ideal candidate must be able to work any shifts within those hours of operation; may require non-business hour support such as weekends and holidays as necessary. This role requires the candidate to work on-location and cannot be performed remotely.Responsibilities to Anticipate:Triaging incoming schedule requests from RMD employees to host secure call conferences for a specific time and dateConfiguring the secure call infrastructure through the management software to initialize each secure conference call on the infrastructureManage availability of service through management of a shared calendar solutionPartner with technical SMEs and stakeholders to troubleshoot unforeseen issues with the teleconference infrastructure As needed, support and assist with any necessary service management maintenance activitiesAs needed, collect and report operational service metrics that detail and summarize service performance and availabilityMaintain system documentation detailing the operations of the serviceSupporting training and education engagements to drive awareness and promote service benefitsOther duties and activities as assignedQualifications You Must Have: BS/BA in Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or any related major with 0-2 years of applicable experience. Significant experience or minimum of 8 years’ of relevant experience will be considered in lieu of a BS/BA at the hiring manager’s discretionExperience in the following technologies:Microsoft operating systems and Intel x86 based hardware experienceExperience with Microsoft Office Suite – including VisioExperience with Microsoft Outlook/ExchangeWeb-based interfacesExperience in real-time problem solving and technical troubleshooting approach and methodologyAn active and in-scope Secret US security clearance US Citizenship is requiredQualifications We Value: Experience in multi-tasking, prioritization and following through on commitmentsPositive, enthusiastic customer service mindset and work ethic with a strong ambition to succeedProven experience in audio teleconferencing concepts and equipmentExceptional verbal and written communication skillsExceptional judgment and decision-making skills Ability to work in a dynamic environment and perform well in high pressure situationsWhat We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.
